p: The most common mechanisms LHDs used for communicating with other organizations participating in the antiviral response were to following: email (56%), blast-fax (53%), phone (49%), and in-person/face-to-face meetings (42%). Other commonly cited communications mechanisms were teleconference (33%), websites (30%), and the California Health Alert Network, known as CAHAN (21%). The remaining LHDs indicated that communication with other agencies around antivirals did not occur in their jurisdiction or was not applicable to their health department's response.
